The player must role two dice every round and remove a set of numbers from his or her bar that equal the value of the two dice. If the player cannot make such a combination the game is over.
title: Wipeout

description: Shoot is simple game where the goal is to hit a falling target using a gun. Each game there will be ten targets falling, the goal is to hit as many as possible. The game features five different skill levels.
title: Shoot

description: Course presents the player with a randomly generated obstacle course. The player can select a difficulty for the obstacle course to travel through. The course is shown in a top-down view and the goal is to travel through it (from the top left corner to the bottom right corner of the screen) as fast as possible the player can move through the grid both horizontally, vertically and diagonally.

sample_screenshots.caption: Hard maze. Looks like it doesn't have to be solvable.

title: Course

description: States is an education game that tries to teach the player the states and capitals of the United States. The game has a multiple choice game mode in which the player is presented with either a state or a capital and must select which capital the state has or of which state it is respectively.
title: States

description:
In Pick-Up a laboratory accident has caused four different chemicals to spill all over the floor. It is up to the player to scoop them all back up and drop them in their four specific containers again. The player can collect as much chemicals on the scoop as he or she wants, but when different chemicals come in contact with each other they will react and disappear. The four chemicals are represented by hearts, spades, clubs and diamonds and must be dropped off at the four corners of the screen. To make it more difficult the player's scoop cannot keep still. It'll continuously keep moving, so the player has to dodge chemicals that are not identical to the current chemical on the scoop.

The player scores points for chemicals brought to the correct container. The amount of points rises exponentially depending on the amount of chemicals that are dropped off at each drop. The goal is to earn as many points as possible. The player can choose between 10 different speed levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Going to drop of some diamonds
Mid-game, the game actually gets easier the further you progress because there are less obstacles

title: Pick-Up

description: Match is a digital implementation of the board/tile-laying game Concentration (a.k.a. Memory). In the game up to four players are presented by a grid of eight by eight tiles. As usual in their turn players can pick two tiles which are then unveiled. If a pair of selected tiles is identical, they are removed from the grid and count as points for that player. If the cards don't match they are hidden again. The game ends when all pairs are found. The player with most pairs found wins the game.
title: Match

description: Search allows the user to create Word search games on the Commodore PET. The player inserts desired words (up to 25) and the computer will automatically try to fit them all in a grid. The game also comes with an existing database of words that can be used. Different layouts can be generated for each set of words because the PET uses a randomly picked position for the first word. When the puzzle is completed it can be printed using the PET's printer.
title: Search

description: In Catch! the objective is to move an avatar freely around the screen in eight directions and try to catch balls thrown by the computer. The AI always makes sure that it's possible to catch the balls from the position of the player at the time of throwing, but that doesn't mean it'll always be easy.
title: Catch!

description:
In Police! the player takes on the role of a police agent in his squad car. The game plays in two parts, both taking place on the same map. In the first, the police agent must find the perpetrator. After that, in the second, the agent must try to capture him.

The game is presented as a top-down road map of the city. The police agent can move along the streets at will. From time to time the perpetrator will commit crimes which will be indicated such as "Freeway accident" or "Bank robbery". The location will remain unknown, but using the map the player can try to devise whereabout the perpetrator is. Once the perpetrator is spotted by the agent he will become and remain visible. It's up to the player to capture the perpetrator by strategically placing roadblocks, which only come in a limited supply. The game is over when the perpetrator is caught.

sample_screenshots.caption: Three characters in a row, the black circle with green line is a road block, below that is the agent and below that is the perpetrator
The thick line is the freeway

title: Police!

description:
In Sheep the player must prevent his or her crops from being eaten by sheep. It's up to the player to herd them back into the barn before it's too late for the crops.

Sheep will walk erratically along the screen and at times some might make a run for the crops. It's up to the player to lead them back to the barn. Sheep will run away from the player, so it's up to the player to line them up correctly to shoo them in the right direction. The game keeps a counter to show how long it took the player to bring all the sheep back.

sample_screenshots.caption: One of the sheep is ravaging my crops
One sheep back in the barn

title: Sheep

description: In Rail the player is in control of twelve track switches on a railway circuit. Each switch can be placed in two positions. The goal is to lead one train from the upper right corner to the lower left corner of the screen. Aside from this special train there are also a number of other trains running on the circuit (the amount depends on the difficulty level selected). If any train comes into collision with another train or derails at a switch, the game is over.

sample_screenshots.caption: I got the special train near the end, but the switch doesn't bend the right way, I'll have to approach from a different direction.

title: Rail

description:
Mwhiz! is a two-player educational game in which the players must evaluate an arithmetic function on the screen to be true or false. Both players have a button for true and false and earn points depending on how quickly they gave the right answer. They can lose points when they give the wrong answer. The maximum number of points that can be received from a correct answer is thirteen, the minimum is one. After about ten seconds the game automatically switches to the next question and players who didn't answer yet receive no points at all. Questions range from addition, subtraction, multiplication and division examples. Players can easily change the frequency of each type of question changing a data array in the BASIC code.

The game ends when a predefined number of points is reached.

sample_screenshots.caption: Keep your hands of other keys

title: Mwhiz!

description:
G-Word is a game that combines elements of Hangman and Mastermind. The player has to guess a word that the computer has chosen. Each turn the player has to enter five distinct letters. The computer will say how many of those letters are present in the chosen word, but not which letters. The player has 20 guesses to find the hidden word.

To aid the player there is an alphabet shown on the screen. The player can hide and show letters of the alphabet to help him or her remember which letters were already eliminated from play.
title: G-Word

description: Ram is a two-player board game in which both players must try to cross the board with one of their pieces. Each player starts with a number of pieces, which can stack on top of each other. Each turn the player may make a move by moving a stack or single piece in eight directions. The distance moved is to a maximum of the number of pieces that were in the stack. When a stack encounters a smaller enemy stack, the enemy units are removed from play (they have been rammed). A player may not ram a larger or equal sized stack. A ram directly ends the current turn. The first player to get a piece across the board wins.
title: Ram

description:
In Attack!, ironically the player is on the defense. The player must fend off an attack as the sole defender of a treasure inside a castle. The alarm system of the treasure will auto-destruct the treasure after the inner vault security has been breached thrice. So it's up to the player to thwart the waves of attackers and make sure that does not happen.

The player can move around in the castle and fire his or her weapon, both in eight directions. The attackers will tear down walls to make it easier for future waves, but the player has the option to rebuild walls as long as they are not completely destroyed. The player can try to find time for this in between attacking waves.

If an enemy comes face to face with the player, he will sacrifice himself and two new attackers will join the attack in its stead.
title: Attack!

description: Emaze, short for electronic maze, puts the player in a rapidly changing electronic maze. The goal is to find the exit of the maze at the lower right corner of the screen. The maze is presented in a top-down fashion and changes itself over time. The player must find the exit to the maze within the time limit or lose. There's a beginner and expert mode. The expert mode has an additional "bounce" mechanic.
title: Emaze!

description: Duel! is a two-player board game. Each player has a number of pieces, one of which is a king. The goal is to either remove the other player's king from play or move your own king into the other king's starting position. Pieces have numbers that indicate the number of tiles they can move each turn. Unlike chess, all pieces can move in any direction and even change direction during a turn, but they can only change direction once. It's only possible to capture other pieces on the last move of a sequence.
title: Duel!

description: Skeet! is a clay pigeon shooting game. Pressing any button on the keyboard will throw a clay pigeon across the screen. The player can try to shoot it, again by pressing any button on the keyboard.
title: Skeet!

description:
Pong! is collection of three Pong-style games: tennis, hockey and squash and features an additional practice mode. All game modes are for two players and require the players to bounce a ball back and forth. There are four different difficulty settings that determine the size of the paddles and the speed of the ball. The first player that earns fifteen points wins any of the games, or when the space-bar is pressed the game ends when the next point is made.

Tennis functions as the original Pong game, while Squash has players standing on the same side of the field bouncing a ball towards each other via a wall. In Hockey both players have two paddles, an offensive and defensive one. The ball must also be played towards a goal instead of a general side of the screen.
title: Pong!

description: In Clone! the player is banished to the dreaded mines of Milhous. In the mines the player can walk around and collect fuel nodules, this scores the player points. When all fuel nodules are collected a new level is loaded. In each level Clonestrians also wander the passages of the mines. The player can outrun them as they search for food.
title: Clone

description: Add is an educational game for young children that lets the player solve sums. For each sum the game visualizes how "carrying" works to explain the concept to the user.
title: Add

description: The game Drone! is inspired by reports of the Israeli army using pilot-less drone aircraft. In the game the player takes control of a drone airplane and must attack the enemy.
title: Drone!

description: Slide is a fast-paced action game in which the player must try to prevent falling rocks from hitting the ground by catching them with paddles. The game is similar to Breakout, only the rocks don't bounce back. Also the player starts with a train of six paddles. Each time a row of rocks is cleared, one of the paddles is removed from play; increasing the difficulty. The player has six lives before the game is over.
title: Slide

description: Break is a Breakout variant. The player controls a paddle at the bottom of the screen and must try to remove all layers of bricks at the top by bouncing a ball against them. If a ball hits the floor the ball is lost and the player only has five of them. This version features no power-ups, but the player earns new balls when the screen is completely cleared of bricks.
title: Break

description: Acigol is a puzzle game in which the player must try to find the hidden ruleset that governs a set of light switches. The only hint the player is given is that each switch looks at the state of previous switches. The goal is to turn all the lights on. Once the player has figured it out it's still possible to try out different amount of lamps.

sample_screenshots.caption: I finally figured the rules and won the game
Now how to get the last one?
Game start, I turned on the first light

title: Acigol

description: Ballon Redden is an action game in which the goal is to keep a balloon alive for as long as possible. The player can lower and raise the balloon in an attempt to avoid obstacles.
title: Ballon Redden

description: Car Race ][ is a racing game developed by later CEO of Nintendo Satoru Iwata. In the game the player controls a car and must score points before time runs out. With certain amount of points the time will be extended. The race car can accelerate and steer left and right.
title: Car Race ][

description: The goal in Concorde Landing Simulation is to safely land a Concorde airplane. At the start of the plane the player will take the place of the pilot high in the sky and must follow the on-screen instructions given by ground control. The player controls altitude, speed and direction and must go through a number of waypoints to reach the runway intact. The game features little graphics other than the runway lights when the player nears its destination.
title: Concorde Landing Simulation

description:
Cosmic Cosmiads is a shoot 'em up in the vain of Galaga. The player controls a tank at the bottom of the screen which can move left, right and fire. The Cosmiads fly at the top of the screen and have to be shot down. Once in a while one of the Cosmiads will dive down shooting at the player. The player earns points for shooting the Cosmiads and triple as much while they are diving. Once all Cosmiads are dead a huge Zylon will appear and move down the screen Space Invaders style. The Zylon opens and closes its mouth continuously and if the player manages to fire inside it, it dies.

One twist in this game is the inclusion of fuel. Shooting costs fuel, so if the player misses too often the fuel will run out and the game is over. When the Zylon is dead the tank is refueled and a new wave of Cosmiads appears. The goal is to score as many points as possible.

sample_screenshots.caption: Each level is identical, although now they also shoot diagonally

title: Cosmic Cosmiads

description:
Cosmic Fighter is a side-scrolling shoot 'em up game in which one or two players can compete for a high score. The players start with three spaceships (lives) with which to shoot enemies that appear on the right side of the screen. The ships can move freely on the left half of the screen in order to line up their shots or try to avoid incoming enemies. The ship can fire a laser with a single and double blast in alternation.

The game has infinite levels with each five stages. Each stage is different from the others. In three of the stages the player must shoot enemies, each with different movement and attack patterns and points earned for destroying them. In the other two stages the player must simply avoid indestructible scenery. Each level has the same stages, but the difficulty goes up slightly.

When playing with two players, the players take turns which last until the ship is hit and explodes. Players can earn new ships when a certain number of points is acquired.

sample_screenshots.caption: Finished the first level, now on to level B
The bars at the bottom pulsate and must be avoided
These enemies hug the edge and then launch themselves towards the player
Here you can see the single and double laser. You can never have more than two shots on the screen at the same time.

title: Cosmic Fighter

description: Dam Buster is an arcade game in which the goal is to destroy a dam. The player has three airplanes that will cross the screen from right to left. The player must dodge anti-air fire and drop bombs at the right moment. The game is won if the dam is completely breached before all three aircraft are shot down.

sample_screenshots.caption: The dam has been weakened at some points

title: Dam Buster

description: Brick Wall is a Breakout-variant. The player controls a paddle at the bottom of the screen that can be used to bounce a ball back up. If the ball hits the bottom of the screen the game is over. On the screen are bricks that are removed when they are hit by the ball. The game keeps a score for the number of bricks removed by the player.
title: Brick Wall

description: Debris is a simple action game in which the player must prevent a wall from being destroyed in a sort-of reversed Breakout. The player controls a paddle at the top of the screen bordering some rows of bricks. At random locations from the bottom of the screen shots will be fired at the wall. The player must use the paddle to block the shots. When successful the shot will turn into a new brick. When not it will remove a brick from the wall. If at any point the wall is completely breached, the game is over. The player is awarded points for each blocked shot.

sample_screenshots.caption: Mid-game. The wall has been breached, one more shot at that location and I'm done for.

title: Debris

description: Doolhof is a 2D maze game in Dutch. The player navigates a maze and must find the exit. Added difficulty is that the player can only see a fraction of the maze, so exploration is required. The game keeps track of the player's coordinates, the number of steps made and the duration spent in the maze. There are also teleporters that bring the player back to the starting position.
title: Doolhof

description: Duel is an action game based on the Steven Spielberg movie of the same name. The player drives around in his car while an unknown truck driver tries to ram him off the road for no apparent reason. If the player collects all the pick-ups before being bumped off the road, the player wins and the truck crashes.

sample_screenshots.caption: Try to keep as far away as possible!
Cleared the map, the truck crashes!

title: Duel

description: In Gribbet the player must find a monster hidden inside the computer display. The player can move the cursor along the screen with the goal of moving it onto the tile where the Gribbet is hiding. The cursor will blink quicker when the cursor is nearer to the Gribbet. The Gribbet moves periodically in a straight line, and can change directions when the player is close.
title: Gribbet

description: Lunar Lander is a typical variant of the classic game of the same name. The lunar lander is falling to the moon and the player can apply thrust to brake it. Each 10 second interval the player must give the command of how much thrust to use. Depending on the chosen difficulty level the player has a certain amount of fuel. Fuel also contributes to the weight of the lander causing thrust to have more effect later in the journey. The goal of the game is to land with a safe speed (less than 10 meters a second).
title: Lunar Lander

description: Toss is a simple game of heads or tails. The player can choose how many times to toss the coin and for every time can decide to go with heads or tails. The game keeps track of the number of times the player was correct. The tossing of the coin is displayed using graphics with animations.
title: Toss

description: Zone X is a graphical version of a game of the same name. In the game the player must find the intersection point of two lines on a grid. The invisible lines will divide the grid in four areas (x, o, + and hatched). The player can give a coordinate and the computer will highlight the coordinate on the grid in the right area coding. The game is over when the player has found the intersection point of the two lines. The fewer guesses the player made the better.

sample_screenshots.caption: Found the intersection, the whole grid is unveiled

title: Zone X

description: Pinball is a Dutch pinball game in which up to four players can compete for the highest score. Each player receives three balls and must try to keep it in play as long as possible. There are multiple elements to be hit that can increase the score, but the ball can also disappear along the sides of the flippers. The player controls two flippers and can nudge the table risking it to go on tilt which immediately loses the player the current ball.

sample_screenshots.caption: If the ball reaches this position you earn a lot of points

title: Pinball

description: Ganzen Schieten is a shoot 'em up game for one player. Geese will enter the screen and the player must try to shoot them down controlling the cannon at the bottom of the screen. The player can only shoot straight up or in a 45 degree line left or right. There are two hundred geese and 200 bullets so the player should avoid wasting any.
title: Ganzen Schieten

description: In Gremlin the player controls a Gremlin tank and must try to remove all targets from the playing field before the time limit is over. The tank can move in four directions and can shoot in the direction it is facing. The targets are represented as spades and will explode when hit destroying all adjacent targets as well, including the tank if the player stands too close. When this happens, the player must wait a couple seconds before receiving a new tank.
title: Gremlin

description: This version of Hangman is meant for two players and is entirely in Dutch. The first player can enter a word that must be guessed by the other player. The hangman and gallows will build up step by step with quite detailed graphics compared to most other hangman versions on the Commodore PET.

sample_screenshots.caption: I didn't guess the word in time

title: Hangman

description:
Hartenjagen is a card game (hearts) that can be played by a single player against three AI players. Unlike the version included with most Windows releases this version features a slightly different rule set, but the core mechanics remain the same.

Each player is dealt thirteen cards and must play a card each round in clockwise order. The first player determines the suit and the other must match suit if they can. The person who plays the highest card of the same suit wins the four cards played. The initial goal is to earn as little points as possible. There are multiple cards that score points if they are won:

  • Each card of hearts is worth one point
  • The jack of clubs is worth two points
  • The queen of spades is worth five points
  • The ten of diamonds is worth ten points

If a player manages to win all 30 points in a game, all other players get 30 points instead.

Once one of the players has reached 75 or more points, the rules are reversed. It is now the goal of the game to earn points and each point detracts points from your total. The first player to reach 0 wins the game. The number must be met exactly, e.g. a player with 2 points which scores 12 points is set back to 10.

sample_screenshots.caption: You can throw away your least useful cards when you can't match suit
A got all thirty points and managed to push all three players above the 75 point limit. Points now count negative, so I have a good lead.

title: Hartenjagen

description:
Hypertrek is a version of Star Trek. The player controls a starship and must navigate space in order to hunt down Klingon ships. The player can move through sectors and quadrants in space, fire lasers and energy weapons to destroy Klingon ships and stars. If the player is hit by Klingon fire more and more functions of the ship will be damaged or become non functional. The player can spend an action to repair them. The game is played in turns where each turn the player can select one of the actions to perform.

This version is entirely in Dutch.

sample_screenshots.caption: I accidentally shot in the wrong direction, destroying a star in the process

title: Hypertrek

description: Jackpot! is a slot machine simulation. The game has four wheels which when pressing enter will turn and stop at a given point. The player can hold any of them as long as they weren't held last time. If the player gets a cherry on the first or fourth wheel or three or more of a kind, the machine pays out. There is also a puppet above each wheel consisting of a head, torso and legs. If the player manages to get all twelve parts before earning money from cherries, this also pays out. The player can decide on how many to begin with. Sound is included for the turning wheels. The game is entirely in Dutch.
title: Jackpot!

description:
Labyrinth is an exploration game in which the player is placed in an ever changing labyrinth. The game plays in turns and each turn the player can move in one of eight directions. Additionally each turn all monsters on the current floor may move and more walls will spawn. So the longer the player stays on a certain floor, the harder it becomes to navigate that floor. The goal for the player is to defeat a number of monsters and collect an amount of gold. When the required number is acquired the player must still move to the exit at a given floor.

Aside from gold, walls and monsters there are also jump pads which will launch the player to a different part of the current level, ladders which can be used as launch pads or to travel a level up or down and doors which can uncover monsters, gold or ladders behind them.

If players find themselves stuck, they can press the panic button. Panicking allows them to either jump to a new location (at random) in the current level or to move to another level. Making use of this will increase the requirement to finish the game (number of monsters killed and gold found).

Defeating monsters is done through games of reflex and chance, such as guessing the right letter of the alphabet within a fixed time-frame or playing a form of Russian roulette.

sample_screenshots.caption: I have to play a sort of Russian roulette with him. I have to pick one of nine guns. One of which isn't loaded. If I choose incorrectly I'll die.
The grandfather of Godzilla and Frankenstein!

title: Labyrinth

description: Lizzard is a one button action game. A lizard will move across the screen from left to right. Somewhere at the top of the screen is a fly, the player must press the action button when the lizard is directly below. When the button is pressed the lizard's tongue will shoot up vertically. The player must try to catch as many flies as possible within a time limit.
title: Lizzard

description: PET Mastermind is an implementation of the classic game mastermind. The computer will think of a code of characters and the player must try to find out the code by guessing. After each guess the computer will signal how many of the selected symbols were in the correct position and how many are present but in a different position. There's a limited number of guesses the player can make. The game features four difficulty levels which vary the length of the code and the number of symbols.
title: PET Mastermind

description: This is a text only version of the classic game Mastermind. The player must guess a code determined by the computer. Depending on the difficulty the code will consist of 2, 3 or 4 numbers. The player can guess as often as required and will be notified for each guess how many numbers were in the correct position and/or are in the code but on a different position.
title: Mastermind

description: Meteorites is a variant of Missile Command. The player controls a targeting reticule on the screen and must destroy incoming meteorites. There are a number of bases on the ground that must be protected from impact. Once all bases are destroyed the player goes game over. The game is divided in levels, which determine the amount of meteorites that come hurling towards the ground and the number of points received for shooting them down. Meteorites that hit the ground, but not a base don't make the player go game over, but can no longer be shot down for points. After each level, one of the bases that is destroyed (if any) is rebuilt. The goal is to reach the highest high-score.

sample_screenshots.caption: Animated intro with falling meteorites forming the title
The screen loops at the sides, for both the meteorites and the targeting reticule.

title: Meteorites

description: In Microjump a character will bounce around the floor in parabolic paths. Each jump has a different height, distance, and speed. The player controls a hole in the floor which can be moved left or right. The goal of the player is to catch the jumping character as many times as possible in the given time limit. The player can receive bonus time for additional points.
title: Microjump

description: Microstring is an action game about timing and perception, that has little to do with a certain type of women's underwear. The player controls a symbol in the middle of the screen. At the top and bottom a scrolling string with beads is displayed. The goal of the game is to touch all beads on both strings as quickly as possible. The catch is that the player can only move up and down and that the symbol re-centers as soon as it hits the string or when the player lets go of the cursor keys. Thus the player must try to time his or her actions correctly so that the symbol arrives at the string just as the desired bead scrolls past. Beads must be touched alternatively from the top and bottom string. Once all beads are touched the game is over and the player is informed about how long it took.

sample_screenshots.caption: The player and the two strings of beads
Near the end of the game

title: Microstring

description:
In this Golf game, the player has access to one 18-hole golf course. The game uses a top down perspective for everything up to the green, where it switches to a side view. The player doesn't have to aim, but only has to select which club to use (from a selection of twelve different clubs and a putter) and whether to hit the ball with a fade or draw effect or just straight. When using irons the player can also select a percentage of full strength to swing with.

The player can select from various handicaps to adjust the score.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game begins on a negative note

title: Golf

description: Osero is an adaptation of the board game Othello. The player can play against an AI opponent in two different difficulty levels. The player can choose to play black or white and whether to start or not. The normal rules of the game apply as player and AI take turns putting their pieces on the board and trying to gain a majority control. Each collection of tokens flanked by two tokens of the other colour change colour (horizontally, vertically or diagonally).
title: Osero

description:
Pesten is a Dutch card game for children. The goal is to lose all your cards by putting them on the discard pile. Players take turns discarding cards, with the rule that the discarded card must either match suit or value with the card on top of the discard pile. If no card matches the criteria the player must draw one card. There are a number of "pestkaarten" (bully cards). Any 2 requires the opponent to draw 2 cards and skip a turn, a joker requires the opponent to draw five cards, an 8 requires the opponent to skip a turn. A Jack can be played at any time and afterwards the player may decide which suit should be played afterwards.

In this computer game adaptation the player takes on a single AI opponent and two decks of cards are used.

sample_screenshots.caption: The end is so close, yet so far away...

title: Pesten

description: Racebaan is a top-down racing game in which the player must try to guide a figure to the end of a track as quickly as possible. If any of the borders of the track are hit the figure will stand still for roughly three seconds. There are five different race tracks on which the game can be played.
title: Racebaan

description: Rebount is a two-player game in which players must bounce discs on a U-shaped track. The final length of the track has certain score zones in which the players must try to have their discs end up. But once there they can still be bounced out of the zone when hit by another disc. The players take turns throwing discs by selecting a lane and pressing the throw button for a certain time to signify how far you want to throw.

sample_screenshots.caption: White has two discs in the score zone

title: Rebount

description: Heart's Desire is an action game in which the player must try to catch the heart, while avoiding the obstacles and robots. There are multiple levels and each level the amount of robots and obstacles increases.
title: Heart's Desire

description: This adaptation of Sargon II allows the player to play chess against the computer with 7 different difficulty levels. Moves are made by inputting the current and desired coordinates of the piece you want to play. The current state of the board is visualized on screen. It's not possible to play against a human opponent nor to choose your starting colour.
title: Sargon2

description: Schieten is a simple shooting game where a cannon moves from top to bottom and back on the left side of the screen and holes are shown on the right side of the screen. To score points the player must shoot at the right time so that the bullet goes into the holes. There are multiple rounds with different hole locations. Each round the player has a limited number of shots. At the end of the last game the player is shown the number of points scored.
title: Schieten

description: Schuifspel is a sliding puzzle game. At the start of the game, the player can enter a text of 15 letters. This text is then shuffled into a 4x4 playing field. The goal is to get the text back in order by sliding the tiles with letters. A tile can only slide horizontally or vertically and only to an empty spot of which there is only one.
title: Schuifspel

description: Snakes is a two player game in which both players control a snake. The first player to bump into the other player or him/herself loses. At the start of the game the length and speed of the snakes can be decided. Unlike other snake games, there is no mechanic of eating food and growing the snakes.

sample_screenshots.caption: Two snakes moving across the screen.

title: Snakes

description:
Ski allows the player to participate in multiple different ski events:

  • Downhill
  • Slalom
  • Giant Slalom
  • Olympic

In each event the player must control the skier. The skier can be given a boost and be turned left and right.

The distance and track width of all the events can be adjusted.
title: Ski

description: Space Ace is a shooting game with a first person perspective. The player can scroll his or her view in eight directions and lock the current vector to keep moving in that direction. Space ships will appear scrolling through the game world which have to be shot down. Some space ships also try to fire back at the player. The game is over when the shields of the player are depleted.
title: Space Ace

description: Space Fight is a simple shooting game for two players. Both players control a space ship on the screen. They can move it in eight directions and accelerate them as well. Both ships can fire blasts. Firing against the other player scores a hit. When a blast misses it creates a dot on the screen which can be collided with. The game keeps track of the number of hits, collisions and blasts fired.
title: Space Fight

description: Starburst is a game similar to Missile Command but adapted to the limitations of the system. In the game the player controls a single cannon at the bottom of the screen and must fire missiles at incoming atomic bombs. The player can target a position on the screen where the missiles should explode, but must guess the trajectory of the bombs and estimate the travelling time of their missiles to make a hit. Once one of the bombs hits the cannon or a city it's game over.
title: Starburst

description: Super Doolhof is a first person maze exploration game. The goal is simple, to find the cheese at the exit of the maze through navigating its corridors. The player can opt to enable three guides to help out: Distance to cheese, looking direction and leaving tracks.

sample_screenshots.caption: White tile is the starting point, I'm back where I started!
Maybe go to the right now?

title: Super Doolhof

description: Target Pong is a simple arcade game similar to Slashball, where a ball on the screen must hit a moving target. The player can place diagonal bars to make the ball bounce in a different direction. There is no friction so the ball never slows down. The game keeps track of the score of the last game and the average of all games. It supports hot-seat play for up to 9 players and has 9 different difficulty levels which changes the speed of the ball and target.

sample_screenshots.caption: Average score of multiple games is kept
diagonal bars can point two different ways

title: Target Pong

description: Target Golf is a golfing simulation where the player must try to hit the target with the golf ball. With each target, the player has three balls to try. Each hole has different wind speeds and directions as well as distances. The player can give a direction to aim in (keys A through L) and choose from eight different clubs to use (keys 2 through 9).
title: Target Golf

description: Zeeslag is the Dutch name for Battleship. The game plays similar to the traditional board game. The player can place five ships (of size 1 through 5) on a grid in horizontal, vertical or diagonal position. The computer does the same and the players must try to hit all grid positions of the enemy's ship without being able to see what their positions are. The player can fire as many times in a turn as he or she has ships left. The player who first disables the other's ships wins. It's possible to play against the computer or another player.

sample_screenshots.caption: Choose where you want to place your ships, by typing in asterisks.

title: Zeeslag

description: Number-Toe is a twist on the classic Tic-Tac-Toe. Instead of placing noughts and crosses on the 3x3 grid, players place the numbers 1 through 9. Each number can only be placed on the grid once. The goal is to put a number that makes any two of three numbers in a horizontal, vertical or diagonal line the sum of the third. The game requires two players.

sample_screenshots.caption: The game keeps track of the score
Easy victory because I misinterpreted the rules...

title: Number-Toe

description: Race Track allows the player to race on a single racetrack as well as create personalized race tracks in the game. Editing the race track is done by navigating the cursor over the track and pressing space to add or remove parts of the track. Actual racing has an almost turn based characteristic where the player can input a desired acceleration direction (eight possible directions) and the car will update with that information in the next tick. Racing supports up to two players.

sample_screenshots.caption: trying to avoid my newly created obstacle
Start of a single player race

title: Race Track

description: Ski! is a simple skiing game with two buttons that make the skier move left or right on the screen. The goal is to pass through twenty checkpoints on a downhill slope without hitting the flags or the edges of the screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: Oops, hit the edge of the screen!

title: Ski!

description: PET Super Baseball is a baseball game for two players. While pitching the player can choose the type of ball to throw and reposition the out-field players. While batting the player can time the swing and determine the actions of the third base runner.
title: PET Super Baseball

description: Star Lord is a play-by-mail game in which players must try to conquer the galaxy using their starships. Only one player can be emperor of the galaxy at a given time. Players send their orders through mail and receive back the results. Results were printed with a colour printer. Because of the expanses involved with running the game each turn played cost actual money for the player.
title: Star Lord

description: Jotto is a word guessing game. The player must guess a five letter word by trying different other five letter words. The computer will then tell the player how many "jots" he has: matching letters. The goal is to guess the word in as few turns as possible.

sample_screenshots.caption: Ok, next time perhaps I should think of a strategy first :)

title: Jotto

description: Insulter is a parody of Eliza. Instead of trying to be helpful to the player this chatterbot just tries to get under his or her skin by throwing unwarranted insults, foul-mouthing and threats. As a player all you can do is feed sentences to the AI, which will be interpreted lightly and responded to.

sample_screenshots.caption: As far as predictions of what the internet would feel like go...

title: Insulter

description: In People the player has to think of a person and the computer will guess who the player is thinking of, by asking simple yes and no questions. Whenever the player was thinking of someone not in the computer's database that person will be added. It's possible to export and import existing databases that can be shared with friends.

sample_screenshots.caption: My starting database only had Woody Allen as a male :)

title: People

description: The Vanishing Maze is a randomly generated maze game with a twist. The game is played from a top down view and the goal for the player is to escape a maze. The player can choose from three different maze sizes, the largest of which fills an entire screen. The twist in this game is the fact that the player gets to view the maze while it's being randomly generated, but then the whole maze disappears and the player must navigate on a blank screen. The player must try to remember the path he needed to go. If the player manages to reach the end without hitting a wall the player earns the full 1000 points. The player loses points if walls are hit. Halls that are hit are also drawn again on the screen.

sample_screenshots.caption: The walls that I hit have become visible.
I'm doing very well, no walls hit yet!
I have just a second to memorize the route

title: The Vanishing Maze

description: Grungy Towers is a game in the vein of Clue. A murder has been committed and the player must try and find out who did it. The player can navigate through the estate and when encountering characters they will tell the player where they were at the time of the murder and raise suspicions about the other characters. One of them will be lying and it's up to the player to find out who. The player can accuse someone multiple times but loses a rank if it's wrong.
title: Grungy Towers

description: Explore is a simple text-based exploration game. It uses a simple text parser with which the player can move around. The game world is divided into multiple levels of a cavern complex. The goal for the player is to find coins and to escape unharmed. From time to time the player will encounter enemies that will bar the player's way. It's up to the player to fight them or to bargain with them. Fighting them will reduce the player's vitality, but bargaining will cost the player coins.

sample_screenshots.caption: Well that was a short game! :)
The text parser is very limited
No deal, nasty gnome! I'll just fight you and take your money instead.

title: Explore

description: Chessboard allows two players to play chess on the PET. It visualizes the chess board and records every move so that the match can be played back on later time.
title: Chessboard

description: Chase places the player in a high voltage maze. The player must try to outwit the five security machines that are trying to destroy him or her. Scattered across the screen are electrified crosses. The player must try to lure the machines into the crosses to take them out, while avoiding hitting a cross or machine himself. The player can move in nine directions. As opposed to an earlier version of Chase, this version uses a real-time system for the gameplay so timing also plays a factor.
title: Chase

description: Tic-Tac-PET is an educational Tic-Tac-Toe game where the player must solve equations to place his Xs and Os. The game features various difficulty levels.

sample_screenshots.caption: Solving math problems to play the game

title: Tic-Tac-PET

description: LadyBug is a version of, well, Lady Bug for the PET. It features the same gameplay of dot-eating, revolving doors, a cage letting out monsters and a smart bomb to kill them, all presented in text-mode "graphics".

sample_screenshots.caption: Caught by an enemy, turning you into an inverted "X"
Starting out, the Ladybug is the "o" at the bottom centre

title: LadyBug

description: 17 und 4 is the german equivalent of the cardgame Blackjack. The dealer starts with a hidden card and a visible card. The player gets two cards. After entering how much money you want to bet, the player chooses if he wants another card or not. Target is to get as close to 21 points as possible, but getting more than 21 is an automatic loss. After the player is satisfied with his points, the dealer chooses to add more cards or not. Whoever is closer to 21 points wins. Having 21 points exactly is an automatic win.
title: 17 und 4

description: BioTerror! is a turn-based strategy game. Cities in the U.S.A. have been infected and you have to research a cure. Putting a city under quarantine may slow down the infections, but it also limits your research resources. After you found the cure, you have to share it with each infected city.

sample_screenshots.caption: The quarantine doesn't hold anymore. One correct code for the cure has been found.
Two cities have been quarantined and the research level was upgraded.
Game start. Two cities are infected.

title: BioTerror!

description: They are searching the space station for you, so move fast. Choose one of eight directions and fire your laser gun or anti-robot missile. You have up to three actions per turn. The space station is shown from above, your character is a circle and the enemies are asterix and diamonds. Try to reach the exit before you are killed.
title: Escape from the Death Planet

description: In Oil's well, you control an robotic oil collecting arm. Follow the underground tunnels and collect the oil dots with your arm. By the press of a button you can retract your arm very fast to avoid getting hit by one of the enemies that run around in the tunnels.
title: Oil's Well

description: Pet Panic is a conversion of the arcade game Space Panic. You have to defeat the enemies on each stage by digging a hole, wait for the enemy to fall in the hole and then fill up the hole again. There are multiple screen wide platforms that are connected vertically with stairs. Your mission is made extra hard by your limited oxygen supply, which acts like a timer running down.

sample_screenshots.caption: Title screen of the updated version

title: Pet Panic

description: Petchess 8000 is a chess game for the 80 column mode. The chessboard is presented in 2D. You have to enter your moves with chess coordinate notation, e.g. "e2e4".

sample_screenshots.caption: I should not confound the king with the queen

title: Petchess 8000

description: The user must maneuver through a field of landmines (by using the keypad to move up, down left and right) to collect all of the prizes distributed throughout the field. If the user comes into contact with a landmine - the music plays and the player is : Z-A-Ped
title: Z-A-P

description: Off-The-Wall is an arcade games similar to Target Pong. The player can place diagonal bars to make the ball bounce in a different direction. There is no friction so the ball never slows down. It supports hot-seat play for up to 9 players and has 9 different difficulty levels which changes the speed of the ball and target. The ball is not allowed to hit the walls.
title: Off-The-Wall

description: Mill game is a strategic board game for 2 players. The program detects all invalid entries. The board, player men, moves and status summary are displayed on screen with graphics.
title: Mill Game

description: This conversion of the board game backgammon lets you play vs. the PET.
title: Backgammon

description:
Life For Your PET is a simulation of Conway's Game of Life for the Commodore PET. The player can draw his or her own patterns and watch how they evolve based on the simple rules of Conway's Game of Life.

  • Any live cell with fewer than two live neighbours dies, as if caused by under-population.
  • Any live cell with two or three live neighbours lives on to the next generation.
  • Any live cell with more than three live neighbours dies, as if by overcrowding.
  • Any dead cell with exactly three live neighbours becomes a live cell, as if by reproduction.

This Life package contains two versions: one on a grid of 40x25 and another on a grid of 64x64 cells.
title: Life For Your PET

description:
ZZYP-PAX for PET #1 is a compilation of two games:

  • Iron Planet - The player must rescue the princess from the laser sword wielding dark prince using a trusty robot.
  • Hangman - The classic word guessing game with a visual of the hanged man.
title: ZZYP-PAX for PET #1

description:
ZZYP-PAX for PET #2 is a compilation featuring two card games:

  • Black Bart - a mean-mouthed poker player.
  • Black Bret - a blackjack game for one or two players.
title: ZZYP-PAX for PET #2

description:
ZZYP-PAX for PET #3 is a compilation featuring two games:

  • Block - play against the PET or another player trying to block another.
  • Football - a visual football game that can be played against the PET or another player.
title: ZZYP-PAX for PET #3

description:
Logic Games-1 is a collection of six games that previously appeared in Basic Computer Games, with improved graphics. The games are:

  • Awari
  • Bagels
  • Chomp
  • Flip-Flop
  • Hexapawn
  • Hi-Q
title: Logic Games-1

description:
Logic Games-2 is a compilation of six BASIC games that previously appeared in Creative Computing magazine or BASIC Computer Games. The games are:

  • Rotate
  • Strike-9
  • NIM
  • Even-Wins
  • Hi-Lo
  • Batnum
title: Logic Games-2

description:
Number Games-1 is a compilation of games that appeared earlier in Creative Computing publications. The games are:

  • Guess
  • 23-Matches
  • Letter
  • Number
  • Trap
  • Stars
title: Number Games-1

description:
Education Simulations-1 is a compilation of five simulation games with an educational twist that appeared earlier in Creative Computing publications. The games are:

  • Animal
  • Fur Trader
  • Hammurabi
  • Stock Market
  • Word
title: Education Simulations-1

description:
Graphics Games-1 is a compilation of five graphical games that previously appeared in Creative Computing publications. The games are:

  • Chase
  • Escape
  • Dart
  • Snoopy
  • Sweep
title: Graphics Games-1

description:
Conversational Games-1 is a compilation of five games that previously appeared in Creative Computing publications. The games are:

  • Eliza
  • Hangman
  • Hurkle
  • Hexletter
  • A haiku composer.
title: Conversational Games-1

description: Spacetrek is a Star Trek variant. The player takes control of a space ship and must hunt down enemies using sensors to destroy them.
title: Spacetrek

description: Galaxy Games is an space combat game where the player fires at the enemy while flying a spaceship. Collision with stars must be avoided. The game comes in two versions: one with fixed targets and one with a erratically moving target.
title: Galaxy Games

description: Target Pong / Off the Wall is a compilation of Target Pong and Off the Wall.
title: Target Pong / Off the Wall

description: Osero and Reverse is a compilation of two games: Osero and Reverse.
title: Osero and Reverse

description:
A Treasure Trove of Games is a compilation of the following games:

  • Lunar Lander
  • Rotate
  • Wumpus
  • Tic-Tac-Toe
title: A Treasure Trove of Games

description: The Dual Joystick Interface is an interface that allows up to two Atari-type joysticks to be connected to the Commodore PET. The interface comes with a sketchpad program and one game: Maze in which the player can use the joysticks to escape a maze.
title: Dual Joystick Interface (included games)

description: The Exclusive Joystick Package is an interface and Fairchild 8-way joystick which can be connected to the Commodore PET. The package comes with two games: Breakout (a Breakout variant) and a Maze. Both games allow for the player to use joystick to control the paddle or escape the maze respectively.
title: Exclusive Joystick Package (included games)

description: Joystick Microchess is a chess game for one or two players. The game can be fully controlled with Joysticks and allows play against the AI or multiplayer on the same computer or via phoneline connection.
title: Joystick Microchess

description: Trap and Craps is a compilation of two games (Trap and Craps) adapted to work with the Creative Software dual joystick interface.
title: Trap and Craps

description: Hurkle and One-Queen is a compilation of the games Hurkle and One-Queen. The games have been adapted to allow play with Creative Software's dual joystick interface.
title: Hurkle and One-Queen

description: Space War is an adaptation of the classic video game for the Commodore PET. Players fly around trying to hit each other with their weapons.
title: Space War

description: Wumpus & Capitals is a compilation of two games: Wumpus and Capitals.
title: Wumpus & Capitals

description: Osero (Othello) & Tic-Tac-Toe is a compilation of two games: Osero and Tic-Tac-Toe.
title: Osero (Othello) & Tic-Tac-Toe

description: Horses is a horse race betting game. Up to 9 players can bet on 10 different horses. Odds start at 10:1 and change every time a horse wins. The goal is to make the most money.
title: Horses

description: Pong for the PET is a Pong variant for one or two players. Players move their paddle and try to deflect the ball, when missed the other player scores a point. Each paddle can be set to player or computer controlled.
title: Pong for the PET

description: Trek-X is a Star Trek variant. The player takes control of the Enterprise and must hunt down Klingons, Romulans, and Oreans in space. The player can use star bases to refuel and recharge shields.
title: Trek-X

description:
Casino I: Blackjack/Roulette contains two games.

Blackjack implements the typical Las Vegas rules of the card game. Players try to get a card value of 21 or as close as possible without going bust.

Roulette is another casino game where the player can bet on number and colors on a spinning wheel. The game comes with full disclosure of the odds so that players can try out strategies they want to use in casinos.
title: Casino I: Blackjack/Roulette

description: Casino II: Craps is a simulation of the casino dice game. It also serves as a tutorial that learns the odds and helps players to become more skilled players.
title: Casino II: Craps

description:
Scelbitape is a compilation of three games and a calendar. The games are:

  • Auto Box - A light cycle game. Players race around the screen leaving a permanent trail. Players must avoid hitting the walls or any trail or lose the game. The game can be played against the AI.
  • Space Capture - is a sci-fi shooting game where the player must defeat the alien using a spaceship. Randomization makes each play different.
  • Hangman - the classic pen and paper word guessing game. The player can guess eight incorrect letters or word guesses before being hanged.
title: Scelbitape

description: 32 BASIC Programs for the Commodore PET Computer is a book compilation that also contains six games. Included are multiple dice games, Roadrace and Wari. The games are also available separately on a cassette tape without the book.
title: 32 BASIC Programs for the Commodore PET Computer

description: Darts is an educational game designed to increase speed on addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Feedback on the answers is given as a distance to the bullseye of a darts board. The time limit is ever decreasing, making the player answer quicker and quicker. The game can be played with one or two players.
title: Darts

description: World's Best Star-Trek! is a Star Trek variant. The player controls the starship Enterprise and must use phasers and torpedoes to destroy Klingon ships using real-time action. To find them the player can use the ships sensors and navigate the different sectors and quadrants.
title: World's Best Star-Trek!

description: Beat the Market! is a stock market simulation game. The goal is to buy and sell stock and invest in bonds or create new stock in an attempt to make a profit. Players start with $10,000.
title: Beat the Market!

description: Arcade-Style Blockade! is a light-cycle game packaged with a number of other games: A Conway's Game of Life simulation and Bounce, a real-time game about missile deflection.
title: Arcade-Style Blockade!

description: Real-Time Lunar Lander!! is a Lunar Lander variant. The player controls a lunar lander module that's in free-fall to the surface to the moon. The player must use the thrusters to reduce velocity and avoid a crash. In addition fuel must be managed or the player will run out.
title: Real-Time Lunar Lander!!

description: Blockade is an action game in which the player must defend a rebel stronghold against an evil empire. The player is the rebel's last hope and must defeat the enemies with their star cruiser.
title: Blockade

description: Startrek is a Star Trek variant. The player takes control of the starship Enterprise and must defend the Federation against Klingons. The player uses short and long range sensors to find the Klingons in the sectors and quadrants of space and then engages them with photon torpedoes and phasers. This version has adjustable difficulty.
title: Startrek

description: Numberama is a number guessing game similar to Mastermind. The player must guess a numeric code and after each guess receives clues from the computer.
title: Numberama

description: States is an educational game that teaches US geography. The player matches states and capitals either through multiple choice or manual type-in.
title: States

description: World Conquest is a strategy game in which the player can try to conquer the world. The player has command over tanks, troops and planes and must engage against enemy nations.
title: World Conquest

description: Startrek is a typical Star Trek variant. The player controls the starship Enterprise and must rid the galaxy from Klingons. Detecting their location within the many quadrants and sectors with long and short-range sensors and then engaging them with proton torpedoes and phasers. This version comes with improved graphics making use of the PET's capabilities.
title: Startrek

description: Mortar is an artillery game. The player receives the coordinates of a target and must fire the mortar at the correct angles in an attempt to hit the target with a shell. The targets are displayed on a radar screen.
title: Mortar

description: Psycho Annie is a chatterbot similar to Eliza. The player can tell Annie their problems and can expect provocative answers back.
title: Psycho Annie

description: Computer Derby is a horse race betting game. Four equally skilled horses are racing and up to four players can place bets.
title: Computer Derby

description: Zzzappp! is a game in which the player fires arrows at a ball. The balls velocity decreases over time. The game keeps track of how many arrows the player has fired and how long it took to hit the ball. The game also provides averages when the game stops. There is no other goal other than to try and increase your average rate.
title: Zzzappp!

description: PET Trek 3 is a Star Trek variant. The player has to save the Federation from invading Klingons. In command of the Enterprise the player must use long and short-range sensors to find them and engage them. This version includes an experimental ray on top of the more typical weapons like phasers and photon torpedoes.
title: PET Trek 3

description: Starbattle is an action game where the player must fire at an enemy starship. The game uses a first person perspective and the player must try to get the enemy in its crosshairs. The game can be played with keyboard or joysticks and comes with full instructions on how to attach a joystick to the Commodore PET.
title: Starbattle

description: Realtime Baseball is a baseball game for up to two players. The game uses graphics and plays in real-time. The players can be seen running on the field and all typical baseball rules are represented. It's also possible to let the PET play itself.
title: Realtime Baseball

description: PET Roulette with Bells & Whistles is roulette simulation. The player places a bet on a number and tries to win money. The program was written as an example program for improving the "bells and whistles" of a simple program.
title: PET Roulette with Bells & Whistles

description: Casino Roulette is a simulation of the casino game Roulette. The player can wager on a number or range or color after which the wheel is spun and winnings are paid out.
title: Casino Roulette

description: Casino Baccarat (Chemin de Fir) is a simulation of the casino card game Baccarat. The player must bet on having a higher card value than the bank. Each player is dealt two cards and has an option to have another one. As per the rules of Baccarat any value above 10 is discarded (so a value of 13 becomes 3). In the case of a tie the bank wins.
title: Casino Baccarat (Chemin de Fir)

description: Casino Craps is a simulation of the casino dice game craps. The player places a bet and then rolls the dice. When rolling a value of seven or eleven the bet is won. The bet is lost when rolling a value of two, three or twelve. Rolling something else it's a point and the player must roll that again, but cannot roll seven any more.
title: Casino Craps

description:
Peninsula School Tape #2 is a compilation of four programs: a kaleidoscope, a Logo variant called WSFN, a script to renumber BASIC lines and a game.

The game is Lemon and is an early lemonade stand simulation. The player must try to make a profit by selling lemonade by the roadside. Money can be spent on advertising and random events such as heat waves will influence daily sales.
title: Peninsula School Tape #2

description: Peninsula School Tape #3 is a compilation containing a drawing program called Draw and a game called Quest.
title: Peninsula School Tape #3

description: Peninsula School Tape #1 is a compilation containing multiple programs written in the PILOT language and includes an interpreter and the software to write your own PILOT programs. The programs include a fairy tale, a conversation about the sky, a dialogue about names, a poem aid and a version of Hamurabi.
title: Peninsula School Tape #1

description: Blackjack is a simulation of the casino card game. The player draws cards to try to get a value as close to 21 as possible without going over and bust. This version allows five players to play and all cards can be seen on the screen at the same time. There are some non-standard rules such as a double payout for a natural 21 and the dealer winning all ties.
title: Blackjack

description: 10 Programs on a Cassette is a compilation featuring a clock, a screensaver like animation and eight simple games. One of the games is a math practice program. The package was marketed more for the ability to use the BASIC programs as a basis to expand into your own games or to learn how to code.
title: 10 Programs on a Cassette

description:
Cassette 2 is a compilation featuring the following Casino themed games:

  • Slots
  • Blackjack
  • Poker
  • Craps
title: Cassette 2

description:
Cassette 3 is a compilation containing the following games:

  • Golf
  • Bowling
  • Hamurabi
  • Robots
  • Checkers
title: Cassette 3

description: Bicycles is a management game in which the player sells bicycles. The goals it make a profit. In charge of the company the player must adjust prices and inventory as well as take account of seasonal changes. The player can start marketing campaigns and must heed inflation.
title: Bicycles

description: Slot Machine is a simulation of a one-armed-bandit. The player pulls the lever and the three on-screen wheels will show a new icon each. Depending on the combination the player gets a payout. The goal is to make a profit.
title: Slot Machine

description: Craps is a simulation of the casino dice game. It features animated dice and offers a statistical analysis of the games played.
title: Craps

description: Tic Tac Dough is a computer implementation of the TV Quiz show of the same name. Players must answer a correct question to place their mark in a Tic Tac Toe game. The first player to get three in a row wins the game.
title: Tic Tac Dough

description: This set of two Atari 2600 joysticks comes with two game programs: a Pong variant and a Breakout variant.
title: Joysticks (included games)

description: Depth Charge is a game in which the player controls a destroyer at the top of the screen. Submarines at different depths can be seen below the surface. The player can fire depth charges by pressing the number keys the value determines the depth at which it will detonate.
title: Depth Charge

description: Bombadier places the player in control of a bomber plane. The player must try to drop bombs on enemy aircraft carriers. After dropping the bomb an side-view animation will show if the bomb dropped in front, behind or was a direct hit.
title: Bombadier

description: Anti-Aircraft puts the player in an anti-aircraft tank. The player moves along the bottom of the screen from right to left and must hit airplanes coming from the opposite direction at varying heights. The player can fire shells at different heights in an attempt to shoot them down.
title: Anti-Aircraft

description: Dogfight is a first person shooter in which the player controls a plane's gun sight across the screen. The player has six shots to shoot down an enemy target. Multiple difficulties are supported by changing the speed with which the enemy moves.
title: Dogfight

description:
War Games Pkg #1 is a compilation featuring the following games with a war theme:

  • Depth Charge
  • Bombadier
  • Anti-Aircraft
  • Dogfight
title: War Games Pkg #1

description: Addition Game is an education game that helps with addition drills in 10 different difficulty levels.
title: Addition Game

description: Othello for One is a conversion of the board game. The player plays against the computer. They take turns putting their token on the board. Enclosed tokens switch ownership and whoever owns most tokens on the board when the board is full wins the game.
title: Othello for One

description: Othello for Two is a computer version of the board game of the same name. Two players take turns placing their token on the gird. Any enclosed tokens change ownership. Whoever owns most of the board when the game ends wins the game. It's not possible to play against the computer.
title: Othello for Two

description: Codes is a code breaking game. The computer will give a code and it's up to the player to crack the code based on hints after each guess.
title: Codes

description: Road Race is a textual racing game. The game plays in steps and the player must manage the throttle of the car to avoid running out of gas or crashing into an object such as a bus. This version allows the player to choose between five different cars to race with.
title: Road Race

description: Slot Machine is a simulation of a one-armed bandit. The player spins the wheels and gets paid out if certain combinations are hit.
title: Slot Machine

description: States and Cities is a geometry educational game in which the player is tested on their knowledge of the 50 US states and their capitals.
title: States and Cities

description: Blockade is a two player arcade game and variant of the arcade game of the same name. It's a light cycle game in which each player controls an arrow that leaves behind a trail of blocks that form a wall. The arrow moves automatically forward and by using four buttons the player is able to steer it by making ninety degree turns. The aim of the game is simply to stay alive longer than the opponent by not crashing into any of the walls. If a crash occurs the opponent will win the round and be awarded with one point.
title: Blockade

description: Hangman is a computer version of the pen and paper version. It only supports play for two players as it doesn't include its own word list. One player types in the word to be guess and the other guesses letters. After each guess it is revealed to be in the world or not. If not part of a hanged man is drawn. When the hanged man drawing is complete the guesser has lost.
title: Hangman

description: Hi-Lo is a number guessing game. The computer picks a number and the player must guess it. hearing after each guess if the number is too high or too low. It's also possible to reverse the roles and let the computer guess the player's number.
title: Hi-Lo

description: Emperor is a variant of Hamurabi. The player is an emperor and must manage the realm by making sure enough food is planted, harvested and stockpiled.
title: Emperor

description:
Flea-Pak is a compilation of four programs previously available separately through the PET Paper Flea Market:

  • Haiku - a haiku generator
  • Computer Haiku - another haiku generator
  • Hi-Lo
  • Hangman
title: Flea-Pak

description: Air War places players in control of aircraft. Players control both the movement of the aircraft and can let it fire missiles to shoot each other down.
title: Air War

description: Yahtzee is a computer version of the classic dice game. The player rolls five dice and tries to make specific combinations. The player can re-roll all or some of the dice in an attempt to get a better result.
title: Yahtzee

description: Spades is a card game played with a standard 52 card deck for four players. Players start with 13 cards and must try to take tricks. The titular spades are always trump cards.
title: Spades

description: Darts is a graphical game in which the player throws darts at a darts board. It allows underhand, overhand and straight tosses at the target.
title: Darts

description: Tic-Tac-Toe is a computer conversion of the classic pen and paper game. The players take turns placing their marks in a grid in an attempt to get three in a row.
title: Tic-Tac-Toe

description: Tommy Termite is a small children's game for up to four players. A termite moves at random around the screen towards the players.
title: Tommy Termite

description: Hangman-G is a computer version of the pen and paper game. This version features a vocabulary of words so that the computer can be played. The player guesses letters and the computer will tell if it's in the mystery word. If it isn't part of a hanged man will be drawn. The player loses if the hanged man is fully drawn or wins when the word is guessed.
title: Hangman-G

description:
Flea-Pak II is a compilation of four programs:

  • Maze Demo - draws a maze (no gameplay)
  • Checkerboard Demo - draws a checkerboard (no gameplay)
  • Hurkle
  • Sea
title: Flea-Pak II

description:
Flea-Pak III is a compilation of four programs:

  • Checkbook - an accounting utility
  • Stars
  • Matches
  • Tic-Tac-Toe
title: Flea-Pak III

description: Hostage puts the player in the role of a governor. The task in this text-based game is to successfully manage a hostage crisis so that the player will get re-elected next term. Terrorists are holding the hostages and will not release them unless their demands are met.
title: Hostage

description: Star Trek 2001 is a Star Trek variant. The player controls the Starship Enterprise and must find and destroy invading Klingons, while avoiding getting destroyed themselves and running out of fuel. This version uses a sound circuit to provide sound with the experience.
title: Star Trek 2001

description: Air-Sea War is a military action game. The player's naval fleet must be defended from attacking aircraft
title: Air-Sea War

description: Micromaze places the player in a randomly generated maze and times the player on finding the exit. The game has optional sound.
title: Micromaze

description: Boggle is a word game in which the player must make words from random letters displayed in a grid. The words can only be created using adjacent letters and letters can only be used once.
title: Boggle

description:
Educational Games is a compilation of three games:

  • Story
  • Guess
  • Hamurabi
title: Educational Games

description: Kite Fight is an action game for two players. In the game the players fight with kites, inspired by Indian fighter kites.
title: Kite Fight

description: Simon is a game based on the electronic game Simon Says. The blinking squares on the screen need to be matched in the same order, requiring the player to memorize the pattern.
title: Simon

description: Lunar Lander is a Lunar Lander variant. The player must land a lunar excursion module on the moon by regulating thrust to balance speed and remaining fuel. The game features an autopilot mode which shows how it should be done and features sound samples while descending and the Star Spangled Banner when a successful landing is made.
title: Lunar Lander

description:
ABTAPE1 is a compilation featuring the following games:

  • Life
  • Othello
  • Mastermind II
  • Multiprimer (math tutorial-deducation game)
  • Klingon Capture
title: ABTAPE1

description: Race Track is a simple racing game with a top-down racetrack in which the player must move a ball. The player can choose different game speeds which will determine how quickly the player must react to make sure the ball doesn't collide with a wall.
title: Race Track

description: Nim is a Nim variant. The player plays against the computer and must take objects from any of N piles (where N=3 by default). The player who takes the last item wins.
title: Nim

description: Blackjack plays a game of the casino card game. The objective is to get a card value of 21 or as close as possible without going over. This version has graphics and a humorous dealer.
title: Blackjack

description: Shark Bait is a word guessing game similar to Hangman, the obvious difference is that instead of being hanged the player becomes shark bait when the word isn't guessed.
title: Shark Bait

description: Gnip Gnop (ping pong in reverse) is a two player Pong variant. The players bounce a ball back and forth, scoring a point if the other player misses the ball.
title: Gnip Gnop

description: Pop Shot is a shooting gallery game. The player must shoot the targets and sounds play when the targets are hit.
title: Pop Shot

description: Moonlander is a graphical Lunar Lander variant. The player must land a excursion module on the surface of the moon, balancing speed and fuel consumption to make sure not to run out of fuel and not crash into the surface.
title: Moonlander

description: Solitaire Poker is a solitaire version of Draw Poker. The game is designed to teach the player how to play, displaying odds for each hand.
title: Solitaire Poker

description: Match Game is an implementation of the Nim variant known as 23 Matches. Player and computer take turns taking a limited number of matches from a pile of twenty three, whoever picks the last one loses.
title: Match Game

description: Brain Strain is a puzzle game where all lights need to be turned on, but different buttons toggle the current state of multiple lights.
title: Brain Strain

description: Kentucky Derby is a horse race betting game. The game has visual horses running around and any number of players can bet.
title: Kentucky Derby

description: Maze is a game in which the player must navigate a randomly generated maze using the arrow keys. The maze can be up to 19x10 tiles large and only has a single solution.
title: Maze

description: Backgammon is a computer version of the classic board game. Players roll the dice in an attempt to move their pieces across the board and blocking the other player.
title: Backgammon

description: Simon is a game inspired by the electronic toy Simon Says. A sequence of sounds is heard and the player must repeat it by pressing the correct keys. After each sequence a longer sequence is heard making it harder and harder to memorize it all.
title: Simon

description: Othello/2 is an implementation of the board game Othello for two players. Players place their marks on the board's grid in turns. Any markers enclosed by two opposing markers change ownership. Whoever has the most markers on the board when the whole board is filled wins the game.
title: Othello/2

description: Checkers is a computer version of the board game of the same name. Players take turns moving their pieces diagonally and can capture other pieces by jumping over them. Pieces that reach the far side of the board are crowned and can move back and longer distances.
title: Checkers

description: Tanks is an action game in which Russian tanks are coming at you. They are faster and can move through mines scattered along the screen so the player has to be quick of wit to blow them up.
title: Tanks

description: Star Trek IV is a Star Trek variant. The player uses scanners to find Klingons in the various sectors and quadrants of space to then engage them using phasers and torpedoes while taking care of their shields and energy.
title: Star Trek IV

description: Concentration is a tile matching game for up to four players. Players pick two tiles and if they match they are removed from play. The tiles resemble playing cards. Whoever makes most matches before the table is empty wins the game.
title: Concentration

description: Pro Football is a textual American football game. The game features 21 different plays (14 offensive plays, 4 defensive and 3 kicks). Each turn the player must enter a play after which the outcome is described. The game only simulates a single match.
title: Pro Football

description: Alien Attack is an action game in which the player controls a starship. The player must avoid meteorites and shoot down enemies in the form of aliens and space pirates.
title: Alien Attack

description: Fighter Pilot is an action game in which the player is rated on their ability to shoot down enemy pilots. The game is player uses cross hairs to line up their shots, while manning the gunner's sights.
title: Fighter Pilot

description: Wrap Trap is a light-cycle game. The player and computer move around the screen and leave behind a trail. The first player to hit a trail or the boundaries of the screen loses the round.
title: Wrap Trap
