description: Labyrinth is a top-down game in which the player navigates a dangerous maze. The player starts in the center and needs to find their way out. Blood-crazed carnivores also inhabit the maze and will try to devour the player. The player can use spells to defeat the monsters. Other features of the maze are doors that need to be opened, stairs to different levels and golden treasure that can be found.
title: Labyrinth

description: Draw Poker plays a game of draw poker where the player plays heads-up against the computer. The players receive five cards before betting and is then offered the opportunity to replace a number of cards in the hope to get a better match. At the reveal the player with the best poker hand wins the bet.
title: Draw Poker

description: Hangman is a word guessing game in which the player guesses a letter each turn. If the letter appears in the word its position(s) are revealed, but if it's not a little man on the screen gets closer to the gallows. The game ends when the man is hanged or the word is guessed correctly.
title: Hangman

description: Horserace is a horse race betting game. The player bets on eight possible horses with different odds. The horses will then race from one end of the screen to the other in different lanes. The winning horse pays out. The goal for the player is to make as much money as possible.
title: Horserace

description: Dictator is a variant of The Sumer Game. Instead of an ancient despot or medieval king the player takes the role of a modern dictator. Each turn the player must pay/feed the people of their land, plant crops, sell land and finance education and pollution. The goal is to stay in power by keeping everyone alive and happy and the state coffers filled.
title: Dictator

description: Football2 is an American football simulation for two players. Offensive players can choose from 17 different plays and defensive players can choose from four different plays. Different combinations of plays come down to different odds for the updated situation.
title: Football2

description:
Play-Grams is a compilation of three games:

  • Slot Machine - A graphical simulation of a slot machine. Up to four players can bet at the same time. The three reels spin visibly on the screen and on a payout the coins can be seen rolling out of the machine.
  • Sharks - A skill game between the player and three sharks. The player must make it to the shore and is armed with a spear gun. The sharks will try to eat the player. One shark is more dangerous than the other two and can get angrier when hit by a spear.
  • Hangman - An animated version the classic word guessing game. Each wrong guess the man moves further up the stairs towards the gallows until hanged.
title: Play-Grams

description:
Gamebox #1 is a compilation of games that appeared in the People's Computers magazine:

  • Hurkle
  • Dragon Island
  • Chomp
  • Guess a Number
title: Gamebox #1

description:
Board Games is a compilation of five games and two graphical demos:

  • Yahtzee is a conversion of the classic dice throwing game for up to four players.
  • Blackjack is a conversion of the casino card game for one player.
  • Backgammon is a conversion of the two-player board game in which the player plays against the computer.
  • TREK3 is a real-time Star Trek variant which requires the player to fight Klingons using phasers and photon torpedoes.
  • One Check is a solitaire game in which the player must clear all but one checkers pieces from the board.
  • Bug is a graphics demo and not a game.
  • Revenge of the Bug is another graphics demo.
title: Board Games

description:
Sports Games-2 is a compilation of seven games:

  • Kite Fight
  • Splat
  • Car Race is a racing game with a single track.
  • Breakout is a variant of the brick wall breaking arcade game.
  • Bowling has the player throw balls at the pins.
  • Football is a simulation of a game of American Football in which the player controls the quarterback.
  • Basketball is a simulation of a game of basketball.
title: Sports Games-2

description:
Action Games is a collection of six games:

  • Splat
  • Car Race is a racing game with a single race track.
  • Breakout is a variant of the brick wall breaking arcade game.
  • Bowling has the player throw balls at the pins.
  • Subs is an action game in which the player must hit enemy submarines while evading their torpedoes.
  • Tanks is a battle game for two players on multiple battlefields.
title: Action Games

description: The Dual Joystick Interface is an interface that allows up to two Atari-type joysticks to be connected to the Commodore PET. The interface is the same as in another package, but the included software is different. The interface comes with two games: The light-cycle game Trap and two player shooting game Trapshoot in which players must use their gun on either side of the screen to hit moving targets.
title: Dual Joystick Interface (included games)

description: Torpedo Run is an action game based on the Death Star trench run from the movie Star Wars. The player must outmaneuver enemy TIE Fighters to reach the end of the famous trench and fire their photon torpedo to make the Death Star explode. The keypad is used to move the ship in eight different directions, but the player's ship must be directly aligned with the vent shaft at the end to be able to destroy the target.
title: Torpedo Run

description: Final Frontier is a Star Trek variant. The player goes on adventure in space and uses the available commands to find objects in their vicinity using their ship's scanners.
title: Final Frontier

description: Yam is a collection of two variants of the classic dice game Yahtzee. One version allows for one to six players and uses standard rules, the other only allows play for up to four players, but each plays with four columns to put their scores in. Each column behaves differently. The first column is filled in to the player's desire, the second column can only be filled in from top to bottom, the third from bottom to top. The last column can only be used to mark throws for which no dice were re-rolled.
title: Yam

description: Pontoon is card game similar to the better known Blackjack. In this single player version the player receives cards and can ask for more in an attempt to get a card value of 21 or as close as possible, without going over.
title: Pontoon

description: Man-Eater is a graphical deduction game. The player must surround and capture a shark before the shark eats swimmers in the water. The player knows only the shark's initial position, but does know the shark may only move orthogonally along the grid and only bite diagonally. Each turn the player may move two swimmers into position.
title: Man-Eater

description: Pinball is a computer version of a pinball table. The player shoots a ball into the graphical display and tries to use the flippers to keep the ball in play. Table elements include bumpers, chutes, and gates. Free balls and a jackpot can be won.
title: Pinball

description: Driving Ace is a racing game with two race modes. The first mode offers an infinite track of straights and curves which the player races with limited gas. Collisions need to be avoided. The second mode is a race against the clock on a crowded racetrack. The car's controls include steering, throttling, breaking and gear shifting.
title: Driving Ace

description: Crossbow is an educational game that teaches fractions. The player must enter a fractional number to hit a target on the screen. The game offers three difficulty levels. The first level is meant for children or beginners and offers an on-screen ruler that helps understand the fraction that needs to be entered. The second level shows the ruler only after four misses, and only allows fractions of the lowest common denominator. The most difficult level already gives the player a fraction and requires the addition or subtraction of another fraction to get to the right result.
title: Crossbow

description: Mayday! is an action game in which the player must land a plane that has run out of fuel. The player must learn to control the forces that interact with the plane (life, weight and drag). On each try the starting height of the plane is different.
title: Mayday!

description: Dow Jone$ is a stock market trading game for up to six players. Players can buy and sell stock in changing market conditions. Market conditions are made known through news bulletins. The player can ask the computer as their broker for advice. Settings include to turn on/off the volatility of the market, when on buying large quantities of stocks will have immediate effect on that particular stock.
title: Dow Jone$

description:
Tangle / Super-Trap is a collection of two light cycle games for one or two players:

  • Tangle is a basic version of the light cycle concept. Both players race along the screen leaving a trail and try to make their opponent hit a trail.
  • Super-Trap is an advanced version of the game, with more customizable settings.
title: Tangle / Super-Trap

description:
Checkers and Baccarat is a package containing computer versions of two classic games:

  • Checkers allows the player to play the strategic board game against the computer with the board visible on the screen.
  • Baccarat puts the computer in the role of the dealer in this casino card game.
title: Checkers and Baccarat

description:
Penny Arcade is a collection of five programs:

  • Poetry is a non-game program that allows the player to compose poetry.
  • Trap is a coordination testing game where the player moves two lines across the screen simultaneously.
  • Poker is a game of five card stud poker in which the computer deals the cards.
  • Solitaire is a computer version of the classic single player card game.
  • Eat-Em-Ups is an action game in which the player must eat as many objects as possible before the time runs out.
title: Penny Arcade

description:
Turf and Target is a collection of four sports games:

  • Quarterback is an American Football game in which the player controls a quarterback. The player can punt, pass and hand off the ball.
  • Soccer II is a game for up to two players.
  • Shoot is a hunting game in which the player must shoot fowl out of the air.
  • Target is an ice hockey game in which the player must try to shoot a puck into the goal.
title: Turf and Target

description:
Arcade I is a compilation of two games:

  • Kite Fight
  • Pinball
title: Arcade I

description:
Arcade II is a compilation of three games:

  • UFO
  • Hit
  • Blockade
title: Arcade II

description:
This compilation contains two games:

  • Qubic-4 is a multidimensional version of the classic pen and paper game tic-tac-toe.
  • Gomoku is a computer implementation of the Japanese game of five-in-a-row.
title: Qubic-4 / Gomoku

description:
PET Demo I is a compilation of multiple simple games:

  • Slot Machine is a simple one-armed bandit. The reels spin and the player has to hope for a match.
  • Chase has the player collecting black pieces in a maze that keeps changing.
  • Flying Pheasant is a shooting game in which a pheasant has to be shot.
  • Sitting Ducks is an archery game in which ducks need to be shot.
  • Craps is a traditional casino dice rolling game.
  • Gran Prix 2001 is a racing game with multiple tracks.
  • Fox and Hounds gives the player four hounds which must hunt down a fox.
title: PET Demo I

description: Startrek is a Star Trek variant. The player controls the starship Enterprise and must find Klingons that are trespassing in Federation space. The world is subdivided in sectors and quadrants and the player can use long and short range scanners to find the enemy to then engage in combat with phasers and photon torpedoes. The player can restock their arsenal and recharge their shield at starbases.
title: Startrek

description: Battleship is a computer conversion of the classic pen and paper and board game. Both players hide their ships of various lengths in a grid and then take turns shooting blindly at their opponent's grid in an attempt to sink their ships. The first player to sink all their opponent's ships wins the game.
title: Battleship

description: Quickdraw is a shooting game that places the player in a Western-style standoff. The player must rely on quick reflexes to shoot the on-screen cowboy.
title: Quickdraw

description: Dominoes is a computer adaptation of the classic tile-laying game. Players can play against the computer and have to lay tiles containing two numbers in a way where touching sides must have matching numbers. If no valid move can be made a new piece has to be taken from the yard. The first player to lose all tiles wins the game.
title: Dominoes

description: Slot Machine is a simulation of the gambling machine. The player inserts a coin, pulls the lever, and the reels will spin. Once they stop the player can get a payout based on whether the pictures on the reel make specific combinations.
title: Slot Machine

description: 1000 Miles is a computer implementation of the French card game Mille Bornes. Players try to reach the finish line first by playing cards that either advance their own car or thwart other players from progressing.
title: 1000 Miles

description: Shooting Gallery is a fixed screen shooting game where the player must shoot moving objects on the screen. The gun barrel is displayed at the bottom and the targets move horizontally along the top half of the screen. The player has to account for the travel time of the projectile.
title: Shooting Gallery

description:
This compilation contains two programs:

  • Head Start is a simple game that tests the player's memory. A number of word is briefly shown on screen and the player then has to type it in after it has disappeared.
  • As-Ims is an entertainment program in which popular sayings are mixed up.
title: Head Start / As-Ims

description: Letter Squares is a 4x4 sliding puzzle in which the letters A through N have to be put in the correct order.
title: Letter Squares

description: Trace a Word is a puzzle game in which a block of syllables is given and the player must try to find as many words as possible. The game is played against the computer.
title: Trace a Word

description: Bazaar is a management game in which the player sells goods at a bazaar. The player can borrow money from the innkeeper Gragr to get into business and must then haggle for goods when buying and selling in an attempt to turn a profit and not run further into depths and pay interest in Gragr. Thieves will try to steal goods, and a tax collector will show up occasionally as well.
title: Bazaar

description: McCann BASIC Chess Program is a chess game written in BASIC. It doesn't play a particularly good game, but it does fit in 8K of memory. It doesn't support more advanced moves like en passant capturing and castling, but can be easily expanded with subroutines.
title: McCann BASIC Chess Program

description: Swordquest is a fantasy game. The player goes on a quest and fights monsters in a maze of tunnels. Monsters charge the player when they get near and the player uses a sword and bow to fight them off. Monsters become visible once they are four spaces away from the player and can move three spaces each turn. During the player's turn the player can move, shoot, slash or change weapon, more tactical options allow the player to brace themselves for combat advantage or waiting for monsters to move into position. The goal is to retrieve jewels and a holy sword from a haunted tomb of a long-dead wizard.
title: Swordquest

description: 'Da Mangler is a Chase variant. The player is a prisoner on the screen. Robots try to catch the player. The player must try to lure them into the electrified fences and posts to take them out. The game features five difficulty levels. The easiest difficulty features 10 robots and the hardest features 25 robots. The player moves around with the numeric keypad and the game features sound.
title: 'Da Mangler

description: Othello is a computer version of the board game. The player plays against the computer. Both take turns placing pieces on the board. Enclosed pieces switch color. Whichever player owns most pieces on the board when the entire board is filled wins the game.
title: Othello

description:
Casino Package is a compilation of four casino games:

  • Casino Blackjack
  • Casino Roulette
  • Casino Baccarat
  • Casino Craps
title: Casino Package

description: Qubic-4 is a three-dimensional version of Tic-Tac-Toe. The game is played in a board of 4x4x4 fields. The player and computer take turns to put their mark in a field. The first player to get four in a row wins the round. The computer knows three different strategies and will alternate randomly between them.
title: Qubic-4

description: Go Moku is a computer implementation of the classic five in a row game. The game is played against the computer on a 9x9 board.
title: Go Moku

description: Cribbage is a computer adaptation of the traditional card game. The player plays against the computer. Players receive six cards each and take turns playing cards. Two cards must be laid into the crib. During a round cards are played and their total added up. The value of the added value cannot exceed 31 or the other player scores a point. If a player manages to get to exactly 31 two points are scored. Additional points can be scored for getting exactly 15, playing a pair, a triplet, double pair or run. After all cards are played players score additional points for all combinations that can be made with their hand, including a card cut at the start. The dealer gets additional points from combinations made with the crib cards.
title: Cribbage

description:
Game Package is a compilation containing the following games:

  • Checkers
  • Qubic-4
  • Go Moku
  • Othello
  • Cribbage
title: Game Package

description:
Games Pak 1 is a compilation of six games:

  • Mastermind
  • Acey Deuc
  • PET Pong
  • Battleship
  • Dominoes
  • Baseball
title: Games Pak 1

description: Best of Pak 1 is a compilation of programs that appeared in other compilations from the PET Gazette. It includes one game Battleship and various non-game programs such as a morse code generator, word processor, kaleidoscope, a Star Wars theme song and a previously unavailable program that aids in writing BASIC code.
title: Best of Pak 1

description: Trees is a single-player game in which the player must take care of the growth of plants so that they can grow into healthy blossoming trees. The player needs to provide food and nurturing to two trees.
title: Trees

description: Hunt: Firstworld is the first game in a series using the same Hypergame engine. The player guides the "goodguys", a priest, fighter, burglar and witch around in search of treasure. Along the way they face the enemies in the form of dragons, gnat swarms, and an ogre. After navigating the different environments and having encounters there the treasure must be found and the goodguys must return to the beginning.
title: Hunt: Firstworld

description: Hunt: Filmworld of Oz is a game written in the Hypergame engine. The player controls a party through various locations from the Wizard of Oz and must defeat enemies in encounters. Once the treasure has been retrieved the player can return to the start to win the game.
title: Hunt: Filmworld of Oz

description: Hunt: Haunted House is a game built in the Hypergame engine. The game takes place in a haunted house where the "goodguys" must find the treasure and defeat the enemies in the encounters along the way. Once the treasure is found they still need to find their way back out of the house.
title: Hunt: Haunted House

description:
Hunt Pak 1 is a compilation of three games writen in the Hypergame engine:

  • Hunt: Firstworld
  • Hunt: Filmworld of Oz
  • Hunt: Haunted House
title: Hunt Pak 1

description: Slalom is a skiing game in which the player must guide the skier on the screen between the different gates. The skier only moves in diagonal steps and the player can at any time change the up/down and left/right direction of the diagonal movement. When a wall is hit the skier will bounce against it. The goal is to reach the last gate in as little time as possible.
title: Slalom

description: Stomper is a game of quick reflexes in which an animal flies on the screen and the player must hit it. The player controls a reticule that can be moved over the screen and must hit at the right moment. The player can choose between 10 speeds for the insect to move with.
title: Stomper

description: Hangman is a conversion of the pen and paper game written in PET BASIC. Two players play each other. One player enters a word and the other guesses letters until the word is revealed. For each incorrect letter a piece of a hanged man is drawn on the screen, if the full picture is shown the guesser lost the round.
title: Hangman

description: Minefield Game places the player inside one. The player must reach two people on the screen to save them. This must be done within a one minute time limit. The mines are shown on the screen. For each move the player makes more mines will appear. Hitting a mine will make it explode and instantly ends the game.
title: Minefield Game

description:
Dr. Daley's PET Software Library: Volume 1 is a compilation of 50 programs, including 40 games:

  • Hamurabi
  • Dictator
  • Market
  • Football for 2
  • Baseball
  • Letter
  • Big Letter
  • Math (pre-school)
  • Faces
  • Hurkle
  • Math (elementary)
  • Divide
  • Spell
  • Synonym
  • Hangman
  • Tag
  • Deflection
  • Horse Race
  • Breakout
  • ZZZAPPP!
  • Racetrack
  • Chase
  • Mad Bomber
  • Capture
  • TREK3
  • Swarms
  • Starbattle
  • Qubic
  • Checkers
  • Othello
  • Othello for 2
  • Fox
  • Black Box
  • Backgammon
  • Conundrum
  • Obsession
  • Bible Quiz
  • Maze
  • Wumpus
  • Eliza
title: Dr. Daley's PET Software Library: Volume 1

description: Master Mind is a computer implementation of the pen and paper game. The game allows both for the player to guess the computer's code and the computer to guess the player's code
title: Master Mind

description: Seawolf is an action game based on the Arcade game of the same name. The player controls a submarine at the bottom of the screen and must destroy ships moving along the upper layers of the screen. The player must try to avoid hitting sea mines because they earn no points and only waste torpedoes.
title: Seawolf

description:
This package contains two games:

  • Star Fighter is a first person shooting game in which the player fires down the sights of their space ship and must move in four directions to line up the sights with the enemy.
  • Asteroid is an action game in which the player must cross an asteroid field. The player moves along the screen and must avoid the horizontally moving asteroids.
title: Star Fighter / Asteroid

description:
This compilation contains two games:

  • Hostage- a hostage crisis simulation.
  • Jury a simulation in which the player selects a jury and partakes in a trial.
title: Jury / Hostage

description: Stone Paper Scissors is a computer implementation of the classic game of hand gestures. The player chooses between three gestures (rock, paper, scissors) and the computer as well. The computer uses heuristics to guess what the player might choose and try and improve its odds.
title: Stone Paper Scissors

description: Breakthru is a conversion of the arcade game Breakout. The player controls a paddle at the bottom of the screen and bounces a ball against breaks in an attempt to break them all. Balls that are not returned by the paddle are lost. The player has only a limited number of balls.
title: Breakthru

description: Surround is a Light-Cycle game. Two players move along the screen leaving a permanent trail. They try to box each other in. Whenever a player hits a wall or trial that player loses the round.
title: Surround

description: Petball is a pinball game for the Commodore PET. The player controls the paddles at the bottom of the screen and tries to get a high score by keeping the ball in play and hitting the targets.
title: Petball

description: Tank Battle is a tank combat game written in machine language. The game features a random battlefield with trees, a lake and walls. Six to eight tanks need to be destroyed. Their laser cannons can fire over the lake and destroy trees when hit. When a wall is hit the cannon fire is deflected. A tank is destroyed in a single shot.
title: Tank Battle

description: Trap (Sound) is a lightcycle game with audio. Two players move along the screen leaving a trail behind. The first player to crash into a trail loses the round. The game is written in machine language and features options for diagonal movement, borderless playfield (wrapping around instead), and invisible trails.
title: Trap (Sound)

description:
This is a compilation of the following two games:

  • Kite Fight
  • Simon
title: Kite Fight and Simon

description: Morse Code Game is an educational game designed to teach Morse code. The player can try to decipher codes at various speeds, store messages that can later be played back as Morse code to challenge another person. The game comes with plug for the second cassette port and includes instructions on how to use the plug to add a 6-volt DC buzzer to send Morse code messages.
title: Morse Code Game

description: Blackbox is a computer implementation of the board game Black Box. The player is tasked with finding 5 atoms in a grid. The atoms can be found by firing rays into the grid. Rays will either go straight through, deflect or curve depending on how close they get to an atom. Using logical deduction the player has to find the position of each atom in as few turns as possible.
title: Blackbox

description: Tank Wars is a tank combat game for two players. On a fixed screen two players try to shoot each other's tank first to destroy them and win the round.
title: Tank Wars

description: Fleet is a Battleship variant. The player must find the ships hidden in the grid. The game uses graphics and sound. The game's cassette comes with a version with and without sound.
title: Fleet

description:
Playgroup is a compilation that contains three different games:

  • Rhino places the player in a randomly generated jungle. The player must reach home, but must avoid getting charged by rhinos. The rhinos are initially invisible but become visible once they spot the player.
  • Hangman has the player guessing words, one letter at a time. For every bad guess part of a hanged man is drawn on the screen. Words are drawn from a collection of dozens of words.
  • Reaction Test is exactly that. The player needs to press a button when prompted and is informed of their reaction time.
title: Playgroup

description:
Middle School is a compilation that contains two games:

  • Mastermind is a computer version of the classic code guessing game.
  • Go is a computer version of the ancient two-player board game.
title: Middle School

description: Subs is an action game in which the player drops depth charges. Enemy submarines crawl the sea below and the player scores points for hitting them
title: Subs

description: Butterfield's Encyclopedia is a compilation of over 30 programs by Jim Butterfield, included are various tools. Some games are included such as Battleships.
title: Butterfield's Encyclopedia

description: Wartrek is a Star Trek variant. The player controls the USS Enterprise and must hunt down Klingons, and Romulans and destroy their ships. The player can resupply their energy and weaponry at star bases and can use short and long range scanners to find the enemy. Klingons also have bases.
title: Wartrek

description: Enterprise NCC is a Star Trek variant in which the player searches Klingons and Romulans. When in combat the player can use torpedoes and phasers to try to shoot them while avoiding collisions and their return fire. Unlike most Star Trek variants the player can only take a single hit in this game. This counts for collisions, shots and hitting a star. Energy is only used for phasers and depletes quickly, meaning the player has to find startbases often to refuel.
title: Enterprise NCC

description: Capital Cities is a simple quiz game in which the player must type the name of the capital city of a given country.
title: Capital Cities

description: Pig is a simple dice game. The goal is to get to 100 points before the opponent (the computer) does. The player and computer take turns rolling the dice as often as they wish. Each time the dice is rolled the value is added to the player's total, but whenever an ace (1) is rolled any points earned this turn are lost and the turn is immediately over.
title: Pig

description: Zap the Klingons! is an action game set within the Star Trek universe. The player controls the USS Enterprise and shoots at attacking Klingons. They have to be destroyed before they hit the player.
title: Zap the Klingons!

description: Dropout is an action game in which the player must navigate a ball through a maze without hitting walls or dropping in holes. The game features multiple difficulty levels.
title: Dropout

description: Crosswords 1-3 is a cassette containing three different crossword puzzles.
title: Crosswords 1-3

description: Oil Run has the player control a submarine. The goal is to destroy enemy oil tankers. The player must dodge sea mines to reach the target.
title: Oil Run

description: Dominoes is a tile laying game in which the player plays against the computer. Turns are taken placing tiles containing two numbers. Tiles can only be placed against identical numbers. The first player to lose all their tiles wins the game.
title: Dominoes

description: Nicky Nacky Noo is a simple number guessing game. The computer has a hidden number which the player needs to find.
title: Nicky Nacky Noo

description: OSC Lander is a lunar landing game. In this graphical version the player must carefully manage descent velocity and remaining fuel to land a lunar landing module safely on the moon. The game is lost if the lander crashes into the surface with too much velocity.
title: OSC Lander

description: Breakthru is a Breakout variant. The player controls a paddle at the bottom of the screen and must break all bricks at the top with a bouncing ball. Failing to bounce the ball back with the paddle loses the player a life. This version features sound. The game features multiple difficulty levels and features an attract mode in which the computer plays automatically.
title: Breakthru

description: Checkers is a Commodore PET implementation of the classic game. What sets it apart from other checkers games for the PET is the inclusion of sound for every move. The normal rules of checkers apply where the player and computer take turns to move their pieces diagonally across the board and try to capture each others pieces.
title: Checkers

description: Backgammon is a Commodore PET implementation of the classic board game. What sets it apart from other implementations is the inclusion of sound when pieces are moved. No AI player is provided so it requires two players to play. The game is played just like the physical game. Players take turns rolling the dice and moving their pieces.
title: Backgammon

description:
This compilation contains one game and a music theme:

  • Target is a graphical shooting game in which the player fires guided missiles. The game features sound.
  • Star Wars Theme plays the familiar movie theme accompanied by images of characters from the film.
title: Target & Star Wars Theme

description:
Action Pack is a compilation containing the following games which all feature sound:

  • Breakthru
  • Target (previously available bundled with a Star Wars theme)
  • Catterpillar is a snake variant. Apples appear on screen which the player must eat, but the player should avoid running into the walls or their own growing tail.
title: Action Pack

description:
The Classics is a compilation containing three programs with full sound and graphics:

  • Checkers
  • Backgammon
  • Piano Player plays the Minute Waltz.
title: The Classics

description:
Word Fun is a compilation of three programs with full graphics and sound:

  • Speller is a spelling practice drill with four different types of drills.
  • Scramble is a game in which the player must form words from a collection of ten random letters.
  • Flashcard is a tool in which pre-programmed words can be made to display on the screen.
title: Word Fun

description: Max is a dice bluffing game played against the computer. The player and computer take turns rolling two dice. Rolls are made in secret and after each roll the player must make a claim about the roll, with the caveat that the claim must be higher than the previous claim. The other player can accept or look at the dice. If the dice value is less than the claim, the claimee loses a point, otherwise the other person wins a point. The first person to 10 points wins the game.
title: Max

description: Football is an American Football game for one or two players. The player on offense has to run through the field avoiding the defensive players. Different difficulty levels change the length of the field.
title: Football

description: Horserace is a horse race betting game for one to five players. Players bet on eight different horses. Players start with $100
title: Horserace

description: Battleship is a computer conversion of the board and pen & paper game. Players hide their navy ships on a grid and take turns firing at each other's grids in an attempt to hit the ships. The grid is 10x10 and each player has 3 ships of size 2, 3 and 4.
title: Battleship

description: Swee-Ping is a basic game in which the whole screen is lit up. A ball moves across the screen and colors the entire screen black. The player controls the direction of the bouncing ball with the keyboard. Different games can be played by the setup but the game itself doesn't keep score.
title: Swee-Ping

description:
Series One is a collection of 25 programs for the Commodore PET. The collection comes with 16 games and 9 general utility programs.

The games:

  • Space Wars
  • Motorcycle Jump
  • Saucer Attack
  • Ping Pong
  • Bomb Squad
  • Crack the Safe
  • Bombs Away
  • Bite the Wall
  • Auto Race
  • Break Away
  • And six more titles
title: Series One

description: Baseball is an enhanced version of Computer Baseball. The game plays the same as the original, but features graphics showing the batting of the ball and the running players and ball flying. Each turn the player must pick a number between 0 and 4 (0 being a walk, 1 single, 2 double, 3 triple, 4 home run). If the computer randomly picked the same number the result becomes a fact otherwise the batter receives an out. The player decides the number of innings to play up front.
title: Baseball

description: Real Time Startrek is a Star Trek variant. The game is played in real-time and features nine difficulty levels. The player controls a space ship and must hunt down Klingons. Short and long range scanners are used to find them and shields allow the player to take a couple hits from returned fire. The game features no graphics for the combat and torpedo firing outcome is instead shown in text prompts.
title: Real Time Startrek

description: Dog Race is a betting game in which the player bets on dogs at a dogs race. The payout depends on whether the dog won, the amount bet and the odds.
title: Dog Race

description: Music Mimic is a musical game in which the computer plays a note and the player must repeat the same note. After the note has been played the player is given a second note and then has to repeat both. This goes on until the player makes a mistake in the order of notes or reaches the target number of notes which varies from 5 to 20 depending on the difficulty.
title: Music Mimic

description: LEM: Landing from Moon Orbit is a moon landing game. The player controls the thrust of a lunar landing module and must make sure to not crashland on the surface. The fuel is limited so the thruster must be used conservatively. During play, the game shows a visual of the lunar landing module and the state of the thruster.
title: LEM: Landing from Moon Orbit

description: Maze Game is an action game in which the player must navigate a ball through a maze. The maze is 19x11 tiles and the player must navigate from left to right. The number of mistakes that's permitted is determined by one of the four difficulty levels.
title: Maze Game

description: Labyrinth is a graphical game in which the player explores a medieval castle. Multiple floors need to be explored and on each a treasure chest needs to be found. Adversaries trying to thwart the player include dragons, goblins, ogres, trolls and giant spiders. The player can find tools to aid them such as swords, daggers, keys, magic rings and cloaks. The player can choose a difficulty which results in more or less floors being present.
title: Labyrinth

description: Backgammon is a computer version of the classic board game. The full state of the board is shown on the screen and standard tournament rules are upheld. Players can wager and use the betting cube. The pieces can be moved across the board on their turn based on the rolled dice. The player plays against the computer.
title: Backgammon

description: Five Card Stud Poker is a computer version of the card game. The player plays against the computer. Players are dealt cards, some face up and some face down and make their bets. Betting is always initiated by the player with the best up facing cards. The round ends once all but one player has folded, or after a showdown where the player with the best poker hand wins the pot.
title: Five Card Stud Poker

description: Air Traffic Control is a simulation game in which the player watches a radarscope and has to give orders to incoming flights for which the heights are shown. The player must make sure none of the aircraft collide.
title: Air Traffic Control

description: Tenpin Bowling is a bowling game for two players. The bowling pins are shown on the screen and players take turns throwing their balls in an attempt to knock as many of them over as possible.
title: Tenpin Bowling

description: Cannon Ball is an artillery game for two players. Players take turns firing at each other with a cannon. They need to adjust their angle and starting, taking into account the wind and terrain conditions which are different each game.
title: Cannon Ball

description: Bingo simulates the game of chance for up to four players. Each player's Bingo card is shown on the screen and numbers will be called out one at a time. The first player to get the required pattern wins.
title: Bingo

description: Missile Range is an artillery game for two players. Instead of firing at each other players take turns firing at a group of targets. The players must determine the right angle to hit a target.
title: Missile Range

description: Battleships is an implementation of the pen & paper or board game. This version can only be played with two players. Players take turns placing their ships on a grid and then at turns fire at each other's grid in an attempt to sink their opponent's fleet. The first to manage to sink the entire fleet of the other player wins the game.
title: Battleships

description: Game of States is an educational games in which the player learns the name, capital, and geography of each state of the United States of America. Graphics are used to aid in the learning process.
title: Game of States

description:
Euchre is a computer version of the card game. The cassette tape comes with two versions. In one the computer takes on the role of the player's partner and the opposing players. In the other version up to three players can play.

The game is played with a partial standard deck (picture cards, 9s and 10s) and requires players to call a trump card and attempt to make tricks. when enough tricks are made the team scores a point and the first team to get 11 points wins the round.
title: Euchre

description: Simon Sez is a Simon Says variant. The player must repeat an ever increasing pattern.
title: Simon Sez

description:
The strangely named The Watercress File has nothing to do with the book of the same name and instead is a collection of unrelated software for the Commodore PET. Included are:

  • Tufor Sixate, the name of a robot providing the player with a game of Simon Says in which a sequence of flashes must be memorized.
  • A wallpaper program showing symmetrical imagery.
  • A keyboard testing program.
  • A RAM and display RAM testing utility.
title: The Watercress File

description:
This package contains two action games:

  • Starwar gives a first person perspective from a space ship and the player must line up the sights with the enemy and time the firing of their laser to destroy them.
  • Missile gives the player control of a laser cannon at the bottom of the screen. It can fire in straight lines in three predefined directions. Targets move along the top of the screen and the player must fire at the right time in the right direction to hit them.
title: Starwar / Missile

description:
Chimera is a collection of five games for the Commodore PET.

  • Dragon: Shoot down fire-breathing dragons with a cannon
  • Dragon Hunt: Slay a fire-breathing dragon using a shield for protection
  • Dropoff: Make the opponent's men drop off the board by moving and firing pieces
  • Dungeon: Dig out from under a castle to freedom within 30 seconds
  • Reflex: Attempt to maneuver a rolling white ball through a maze
title: Chimera

description:
Code Name: Cipher is a collection of puzzle games for the Commodore PET.

  • Code Breaker: Mastermind clone
  • Codemaster: Create and solve cryptograms
  • Deceitful Mindmaster: Mastermind game where the player tries to solve a five-letter sequence
  • Memory Game: Practice memorizing sequences against the computer
title: Code Name: Cipher
